properties.NAME: Air Canada Centre
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Air Canada Centre is a multi-purpose indoor sporting arena and concert venue. It is the home of the Toronto Maple Leafs Hockey Club, the Toronto Raptors basketball team, and the Toronto Rock Lacrosse team.

properties.NAME: Al Green Theatre (at the Miles Nadal Jewish Community Centre)
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Al Green Theatre is used  for social and corporate event, theatre, film, concerts, dance; and lectures.

properties.NAME: Alexander Muir Memorial Gardens
properties.DESCRIPTION: Named after the famous composer Alexander Muir.  The gardens act as a path into the tranquil ravine system that includes walking trails.  The gardens are open year round.

properties.NAME: Allan Gardens
properties.DESCRIPTION: Allan Gardens is an indoor botanical garden built in 1910. The building houses six greenhouses featuring plants and flowers from across the globe.  Open year round and free to the public

properties.NAME: Allstream Centre
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Allstream Centre is an environmentally friendly conference venue.

properties.NAME: Alumnae Theatre Company
properties.DESCRIPTION: The theatre company is housed inside an old firehall.  Each year the company offers three productions.

properties.NAME: Art Gallery of Ontario
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Art Gallery of Ontario (AGO) is one of the largest art galleries in North America, and holds more than 80,000 works in its collection.   In 2008 the buidling was redesigned by famous architect and native Torontonian, Frank Gehry.

properties.NAME: Ashbridge's Bay Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: Ashbridge's Bay waterfront park features large beaches, fishing areas, a marina, and the Woodbine Beach boardwalk.

properties.NAME: BAPS Shri Swaminarayan Mandir
properties.DESCRIPTION: This unique-to-Canada architectural monument is made with 24,000 pieces of marble and stone. Discover the more than 10,000-year-old heritage of India.

properties.NAME: Berkeley Street Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: Home to the Canadian Stage Company, the Berkeley Street Theatre presents an array of Canadian and international performances.

properties.NAME: Betty Oliphant Theatre (at Canada's National Ballet School)
properties.DESCRIPTION: Designed by Jack Diamond, the Betty Oliphant Theatre is used by the Canada National Ballet School as a training and performance venue.

properties.NAME: Billy Bishop Toronto City Airport
properties.DESCRIPTION: Located minutes from the downtown core, Billy Bishop Airport serves nearby Canadian and American cities.

properties.NAME: Black Creek Pioneer Village
properties.DESCRIPTION: Become immersed in the lifestyles, customs, and surroundings of early residents who built the foundations for modern Toronto and Ontario at this 30-acre site.

properties.NAME: Bluffer's Park and Beach (Scarborough Bluffs)
properties.DESCRIPTION: Providing a beautiful backdrop for locals and visitors alike, the Bluffs are one of Toronto's great natural wonders.

properties.NAME: Bluma Appel Theatre (see St. Lawrence Centre for the Arts)
BMO Field
properties.DESCRIPTION: BMO Field is home to the Toronto FC (Major League Soccer), Canada's national soccer teams, and the future home of the Toronto Argonauts (Canadian Football League) in 2016

properties.NAME: Buddies in Bad Times Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: Buddies in Bad Times theatre is the biggest, and the longest-running queer theatre in the world.

properties.NAME: Campbell House
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Campbell house dates back to 1822 and was once home to Judge William Campbell.  It is the last example of Palladian architecture in the Toronto.

properties.NAME: Canada's National Ballet School
properties.DESCRIPTION: The National Ballet School of Canada is the world's leader in the training of students, teachers and dancers. It's the only school of it's kind in North America to provide dance training & residential care.

properties.NAME: Canada's Walk of Fame
properties.DESCRIPTION: Canada's Walk of Fame celebrates Canadians who have excelled in their respective fields for a minimum of 10 years.   The stars are displayed throughout the Entertainment District along King Street West and Simcoe Street.

properties.NAME: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation Museum
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Canadian Broadcasting Corporation (CBC) museum features various CBC archival materials that date back to 1936.  The museum also features the Graham Spry Theatre and a number of interactive exhibits.

properties.NAME: Canadian Sculpture Centre
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Canadian Sculpture Centre is headquarters to the Sculptors Society of Canada.  The society showcase's and exhibits contemporary Canadian sculptures.

properties.NAME: Casa Loma
properties.DESCRIPTION: Canadais foremost castle is complete with decorated suites, secret passages, an 800-foot tunnel, towers, stables, and beautiful 5-acre estate gardens.

properties.NAME: Cedar Ridge Creative Centre & Gardens
properties.DESCRIPTION: Situated in a restored mansion, the centre features the Cedar Ridge gallery and rich gardens.  The gallery highlights work from artists throughout the Greater Toronto area.

properties.NAME: Centennial Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: Centennial Park is situated in Etobicoke and was opened in 1967 to celebrate Canada's 100th birthday.  The park features sports fields, a conservatory, a ski hill, an Olympic size swimming pool, picnic areas and a Frisbee golf course.

properties.NAME: Centennial Park Conservatory
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Centennial Park conservatory is located within Centennial Park in Etobicoke.  At a size of 12,000 square feet it features an arid house, a show house and a tropical house.  The conservatory is open year round and is free to the public.

properties.NAME: Centre Island Beach
properties.DESCRIPTION: Centre Island beach also known as Manitou Beach has been used by locals and tourists alike for more than a century.  The beach is located on the south end of Centre Island.  It is surrounded by park space and amenities such as bike and boat rentals.

properties.NAME: Centreville Amusement Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: Centreville is a 14-acre, turn-of-the-century, Ontario village theme park for children located on Centre Island, featuring over 30 rides.

properties.NAME: Cherry Beach/Clarke Beach
properties.DESCRIPTION: Cherry Beach is located within the port lands and features a dog's off leash area, the Martin Goodman Trail and a picnic site.

properties.NAME: Chinese Cultural Centre of Greater Toronto
properties.DESCRIPTION: Home to the Asian Business & Culture Development Centre.  The building houses the P. C. Ho theatre, studios, conference rooms, a resource centre, a reception hall and an art gallery.

properties.NAME: Cloud Gardens Conservatory
properties.DESCRIPTION: Renovated in 2014, the conservatory is situated within the heart of the city's financial district. It features a small greenhouse that is set to the conditions of a rainforest.

properties.NAME: CN Tower
properties.DESCRIPTION: The CN Tower is an engineering marvel and one of the city's most visited sites.  It features the world's highest wine cellar, a fine dining revolving restaurant (360), a glass floor.  For the true adventure seeker, the Edge walk.

properties.NAME: Colborne Lodge
properties.DESCRIPTION: This quaint cottage located within High Park was home to John and Jemima Howard.  In 1873 the couple deeded the park and lodge to the City of Toronto.  The house is a great example of a regency style building.

properties.NAME: Dancemakers and the Centre for Creation
properties.DESCRIPTION: One of Toronto's professional contemporary dance companies, Dancemakers and the Centre for Creation is focused on the delivery of refined and passionate dance to its admirers.

properties.NAME: Design Exchange
properties.DESCRIPTION: Canada's only museum dedicated to the preservation of design which includes the design heritage from an array of mediums.

properties.NAME: EnerCare Centre (formely known as Direct Energy Centre)
properties.DESCRIPTION: The largest convention centre in Canada, over 180 trade and consumer shows are annually hosted at the EnerCare Centre.

properties.NAME: Downsview Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: The vast green space allows for an array of small-to-large scale events such as culture, dining, leisure, sports, and recreation.

properties.NAME: Ed Mirvish Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: A part of the Toronto theatre scene since 1920, the Ed Mirvish Theatre is a picturesque theatre to view special presentations ranging from concerts, comedy, plays, and many more.

properties.NAME: Elgin and Winter Garden Theatre Centre
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Elgin and Winter Garden Theatre features two completely separate theatres and is the last running double-decker theatre in the world .

properties.NAME: Eskimo Art Gallery
properties.DESCRIPTION: Located in the Distillery District, the Eskimo Art Gallery offers Inuit art.

properties.NAME: Evergreen Brick Works
properties.DESCRIPTION: A former brickyard, the Evergreen Brick Works is an urban model for ecosystem planning. Filled with activities for the whole family and a farmers

properties.NAME: Exhibition Place
properties.DESCRIPTION: Attracting over 5 million visitors a year, this massive complex features sporting and exhibition facilities, a nightclub and attractions.

properties.NAME: Factory Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Factory Theatre operates two theatres in a  Victorian mansion, where they have produced more than 150 Canadian plays, and various workshops.

properties.NAME: Famous PEOPLE Players
properties.DESCRIPTION: Located in Toronto's West End, Famous PEOPLE Players allows visitors to immerse themselves in a unique dining experience while enjoying theatre in the dark.

properties.NAME: Fort York National Historic Site
properties.DESCRIPTION: Birthplace of Toronto in 1793 and scene of the Battle of York in 1813, Fort York has Canada9s largest collection of original War of 1812 buildings. Open year round for tours, exhibits, and demonstrations.

properties.NAME: Four Seasons Centre for the Performing Arts
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Four Seasons Centre for the Performing Arts is home to the Canadian Opera Company and the National Ballet of Canada.

properties.NAME: Franklin Children's Garden
properties.DESCRIPTION: The garden, inspired by Franklin the Turtle, is an area to discover nature, play, while learning something new.

properties.NAME: Gardiner Museum of Ceramic Art
properties.DESCRIPTION: A museum dedicated to one of the oldest forms of art.  The Gardiner Museum of Ceramic Art is home to over 3,000 historical and contemporary ceramic pieces.

properties.NAME: George Ignatieff Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: In the Trinity College community, the George Ignatieff Theatre acts as a creative hub ranging from events like theatre,  conferences, and much more.

properties.NAME: Gibraltar Point Beach
properties.DESCRIPTION: Surrounded by eastern cottonwood trees,  the Gibraltar Point Beach is located on the southwest shore of Toronto Island Park. The Gibraltar Point Centre for the Arts is walking distance from the beach.

properties.NAME: Gibson House
properties.DESCRIPTION: Operated  by the City of Toronto, the Gibson House is a museum where visitors experience an exquisite farmhouse and learn more about the rural development of the area.

properties.NAME: Glen Rouge Campground
properties.DESCRIPTION: Toronto's only campground, the Glen Rouge is surrounded by luscious forests and meadows. The campground implements seasonal full-service camping.

properties.NAME: Glenn Gould Studio (at the Canadian Broadcasting Centre)
properties.DESCRIPTION: Located on the main floor of the Canadian Broadcasting Centre,  the Glenn Gould Studio is a much-celebrated venue for its state of the art recording facilities and acoustics.

properties.NAME: Guild Park and Gardens (formely known as Guildwood Park)
properties.DESCRIPTION: A sculptural alluring park and garden, the Guild Park and Gardens is rich in local history and a must-see for locals and visitors alike.

properties.NAME: Hanlan's Point Beach
properties.DESCRIPTION: Situated on the west shore of Toronto Island Park, this beach is Toronto's only clothing optonal beach.

properties.NAME: Harbourfront Centre
properties.DESCRIPTION: Popular 10-acre lakeside cultural site offers an eclectic blend of year-round arts, culture and recreation such as concerts, skating, music festivals and dance.

properties.NAME: Hart House Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: A point of interest in the University of Toronto community, the Hart House Theatre and it's students produce an array of drama, dance, film, and music.

properties.NAME: High Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: High Park is one of TorontoUs largest parks, and attracts visitors each spring for the blooming of its famous cherry blossoms. It also contains attractions and amenities such as recreational programs, a local zoo, a unique playground and a pond.

properties.NAME: Historic Zion Schoolhouse
properties.DESCRIPTION: Built in 1869, the Historic Zion Schoolhouse has been restored to emulate schooling as it once was in the farming  district of L'Amaroux

properties.NAME: Hockey Hall of Fame
properties.DESCRIPTION: Unique to Toronto, and featuring the Stanley Cup, interactive exhibits, shows, and the finest collection of hockey artifacts in the world.

properties.NAME: Holt Renfrew
properties.DESCRIPTION: A chain of Canadian department stores focused on high-end Canadian and international brands.

properties.NAME: HTO Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: Facing the inner harbour with Toronto Island Park in clear viewing,  HTO Park includes an urban beach which is decorated with yellow umbrellas and Muskoka chairs.

properties.NAME: Hudson's Bay
properties.DESCRIPTION: Famously known as being North America's oldest company, the Hudson Bay is a chain of department stores  that operate throughout the country.

properties.NAME: Humber Arboretum
properties.DESCRIPTION: Located nearby the West Humber River Valley, the Humber Arboretum offers trails through environmentally-rich areas like forests, and wetlands.

properties.NAME: Humber Bay Park ( Humber Bay Butterfly Habitat)
properties.DESCRIPTION: Located at a waterfront park at the mouth of Mimico Creek, the Humber Bay Butterfly Habitat is focused on providing habitat for an array of native butterfly species.

properties.NAME: Isabel Bader Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: Located at the University of Toronto, this multi-purpose venue seats 500 patrons whether it be for a lecture, workshop, or a theatrical production.

properties.NAME: Jack Layton Ferry Terminal
properties.DESCRIPTION: Located at the foot of Bay Street and Queens Quay West, the  Jack Layton Ferry Terminal acts as a commuting point to and from the Toronto Island Park with frequent ferry service.

properties.NAME: James Garden Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: Former estate gardens located in Toronto's west end that include rare trees, spring-fed pools, and other seasonal displays.

properties.NAME: Japan Foundation
properties.DESCRIPTION: A cultural establishment aiming towards effective development of its international cultural exchange programs in Japanese arts and cultural exchange.

properties.NAME: Kew Gardens Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: Located in The Beaches, Kew Gardens act as one of Toronto's most popular picnic grounds while having access to the boardwalk on the lakeshore.

properties.NAME: Kew-Balmy Beach
properties.DESCRIPTION: One of Toronto's designated swimming beaches, Kew-Balmy Beach is located between Silver Birch and Leuty Avenues in Beaches Park.

properties.NAME: Koerner Hall (at the Telus Centre for Performance and Learning)
properties.DESCRIPTION: Koerner Hall is a 1,135 seat venue to provide excellent acoustic sounds for all genres of music in its "shoebox" designed venue.

properties.NAME: Lower Ossington Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: A theatrical hub for downtown Toronto's west end,  the Lower Ossington Theatre is home to special presentations, rehearsals, and classes.

properties.NAME: Mackenzie House
properties.DESCRIPTION: Mackenzie House is the restored home of William Lyon Mackenzie, Toronto's first Mayor.  It is one of 10 museums operated by the City of Toronto.

properties.NAME: Marie Curtis Park East Beach
properties.DESCRIPTION: Located at the mouth of Etobicoke Creek near the foot of Forty-Second Street. Most users of this beach come from the bordering Long Branch community.

properties.NAME: Massey Hall
properties.DESCRIPTION: Declared a heritage building in  the 1970s, this live events venue acts as a performance venue for various artists.

properties.NAME: Medieval Times Dinner and Tournament
properties.DESCRIPTION: A family dinner theatre featuring staged medieval-style games, sword-fighting, and jousting performed by a cast of actors and horses.

properties.NAME: Metro Toronto Convention Centre
properties.DESCRIPTION: Offers more than 600,000 square feet of large exhibit, event, and meeting space.

properties.NAME: Molson Canadian Amphitheatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: Located within the Ontario Place grounds, the Molson Canadian Amphitheatre offers concert goers an excellent outdoors venue.

properties.NAME: Montgomery's Inn
properties.DESCRIPTION: A museum that was once a historic home, visitors can delve into the lifestyle of a 19th century Irish farm family with access to the bedrooms, kitchen wing and much more.

properties.NAME: MuchMusic (Bell Media Queen Street)
properties.DESCRIPTION: A Canadian television channel dedicated to engaging the youth through popular music and popular television series.

properties.NAME: Museum of Contemporary Canadian Art,will be re-opening by Winter 2017
properties.DESCRIPTION: A variety of original and thought-provoking exhibitions, promoting innovative art by Canadian and international artists. Over 800 artists have been featured in more than 80 exhibitions and projects.

properties.NAME: Museum of Cultural Heritage of Indo-Canadians
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Canadian Museum of Cultural Heritage of Indo-Canadians is a museum committed to the understanding of India's rich cultural heritage.  (See BAPS Shri Swaminarayan Mandir.)

properties.NAME: Museum of Inuit Art
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Museum of Inuit Art is the only museum dedicated entirely to Inuit art in southern Canada.

properties.NAME: Mysteriously Yourst Mystery Dinner Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: Mysteriously Yoursu. Mystery Dinner Theatre is a murder mystery dinner theatre located in Uptown Toronto.

properties.NAME: Native Earth Performing Arts
properties.DESCRIPTION: Native Earth Performing Arts is a theatre company devoted to the artistic expression of the Indigenous experience.

properties.NAME: Old City Hall
properties.DESCRIPTION: Old City Hall is a landmark building that was used as Toronto's second City Hall and is a great example of beautiful architecture. Today, it is used as a courthouse.

properties.NAME: Onsite [at] OCADU
properties.DESCRIPTION: Onsite (at) OCAD provides the opportunity and space of an art gallery to exhibit students contemporary work.

properties.NAME: Ontario Science Centre
properties.DESCRIPTION: Home to fascinating interactive experiences with over 500 engaging exhibits, live demonstrations, IMAX  films, and Torontots only public planetarium.

properties.NAME: Osgoode Hall
properties.DESCRIPTION: Constructed in the 19th century, Osgoode Hall acts as the judicial landmark of Toronto, with institutions like the Ontario Court of Appeal, the Law Society of Upper Canada, and the Divisional Court of the Superior Court of Justice.

properties.NAME: Panasonic Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: Owned by Mirvish Productions, the Panasonic Theatre is the home  of many famous theatrical productions.

properties.NAME: Papermill Theatre (at Todmorden Mills)
properties.DESCRIPTION: Papermill Theatre is a recently renovated space that seats 164 and offers a retractable seating unit, two fully furnished dressing rooms and an LCD projector.

properties.NAME: PawsWay Toronto
properties.DESCRIPTION: PawsWay is a unique centre dedicated to pets. The centre holds exhibits, special events and programming for pet owners and pet lovers alike.

properties.NAME: Polson Pier
properties.DESCRIPTION: Located on the water, the Polson Pier is a waterfront property that includes a drive-in cinema, patio bar, concert venues, and much more.

properties.NAME: Princess of Wales Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: Owned by Mirvish Productions. The Princess of Wales Theatre opened in 1993 and is the home  of many famous theatrical productions

properties.NAME: Queen Elizabeth Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: Located at Exhibition Place, the Queen Elizabeth Theatre is an auditorium that is the venue for various entertainment events

properties.NAME: Queen's Park: Legislative Assembly of Ontario
properties.DESCRIPTION: A variety of free tour options are available all year round to visit Ontarioas historic Legislative Building (iconic sandstone Richardson Romanesque style building, completed in 1893).

properties.NAME: Randolph Academy of the Performing Arts
properties.DESCRIPTION: Over the last 20 years the Randolph Academy has trained various performers for all major theatre productions in Toronto.  These shows have included Lord of the Rings and Dirty Dancing.

properties.NAME: Redpath Sugar Museum
properties.DESCRIPTION: Located inside the Redpath Refinery, the Redpath Sugar Museum is for those interested in the history of sugar, the development and the role of the Redpath family in Canada's industry sector, and much more.

properties.NAME: Aviva Centre (formerly known as the Rexall Centre)
properties.DESCRIPTION: Aviva Centre is a tennis stadium at York University and is home to the Rogers Cup.

properties.NAME: Ricoh Coliseum
properties.DESCRIPTION: Located at Exhibition Place, the Ricoh Coliseum is home to the Toronto Marlies (American Hockey League) and concerts.

properties.NAME: Ripley's Aquarium of Canada
properties.DESCRIPTION: Canadaes largest aquarium. Interactive attractions feature over 5.7 million litres of water and more than 16,000 marine animals.

properties.NAME: Riverdale Farm
properties.DESCRIPTION: On 7.5 acres, Riverdale Farm is an historic working farm with many scenic pathways and farm animals.

properties.NAME: Riverdale Park East
properties.DESCRIPTION: A Toronto park that is great for all seasons. Riverdale Park East has three multipurpose sport fields, seven tennis courts, an outdoor ice rink, two baseball diamonds, and much more.

properties.NAME: Riverdale Park West
properties.DESCRIPTION: A Toronto park that is great for all seasons. Riverdale Park West has three multipurpose sport fields, seven tennis courts, an outdoor ice rink, two baseball diamonds, and much more.

properties.NAME: Rogers Centre
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Rogers Centre is a multipurpose venue. Home to the Toronto Blue Jays (Major League Baseball) and the Toronto Argonauts (Canadian Football League - 2015 season).

properties.NAME: Rosetta McClain Gardens
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Rosetta McClain Gardens is a great place to safely see the Scarborough Bluffs and has beautiful rose gardens. There are signs available in braille, textured paths, raised planters, and a ramp to ensure accessibility.

properties.NAME: Rouge Beach
properties.DESCRIPTION: One of Toronto's designated swimming beaches, Rouge Beach has two distinct areas a white sand beach and a marsh habitat.

properties.NAME: Rouge Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: Soon to be Canada's first national park within an urban area, the park is Toronto's largest. It features hiking trails, a campground and Rouge Beach.

properties.NAME: Roy Thomson Hall
properties.DESCRIPTION: Opened in 1982, Roy Thomson Hall is home of the Toronto Symphony Orchestra and the Toronto Mendelssohn Choir.

properties.NAME: Royal Alexandra Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: Owned by Mirvish Productions. The Royal Alexandra Theatre built in beaux-arts architectural style in 1907. It is home to numerous performances and performers.

properties.NAME: Royal Conservatory of Music
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Toronto Conservatory of Music was founded in 1886.

properties.NAME: Royal Ontario Museum
properties.DESCRIPTION: Canadaes largest museum of natural history and world cultures, presents engaging galleries of art, archaeology, and natural science from around the world.

properties.NAME: Ryerson Image Centre
properties.DESCRIPTION: The RIC is dedicated to the public exhibition, research, study and teaching of photography including , installation art and film and media.

properties.NAME: Ryerson Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: Ryerson Theatre is home to various productions which includes concerts, film presentations, and Ryerson Theatre and Fashion Schools productions.

properties.NAME: Sarah and Chaim Neuberger Holocaust Education Centre
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Sarah and Chaim Neuberger Holocaust Education Centre provides all its visitors a complete understanding of the Holocaust.c 30, 000 students pass through its doors during educational trips.

properties.NAME: Scarborough Museum
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Scarborough Museum and its gardens are located within Thomson Memorial Park.r It is one of 10 museums operated by the City of Toronto.d The Museum looks back on the story of Scarborough's roots and history.

properties.NAME: Scarborough Village Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: Theatre Scarborough is an umbrella organization consisting of Scarborough Music Theatre, Scarborough Players, and Scarborough Theatre Guild.  Performances take place at the Scarborough Village Community Centre.

properties.NAME: Solar Stage Children's Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: Solar Stage Children's Theatre is dedicated to providing theatrical presentations for children.

properties.NAME: Sony Centre for the Performing Arts
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Sony Centre for the Performing Arts  is a performing arts venue with a range of events that include concerts, dance, and much more.

properties.NAME: Spadina Museum
properties.DESCRIPTION: Operated by the City of Toronto, the Spadina Museum is a historic manor house that allows visitors to learn about the history and architecture of  late 19th century to early 20th century Toronto.

properties.NAME: St. James Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: A large green space, home to a Victorian garden, live performances, and is a popular spot for photos. The park is adjacent to historic St. James Cathedral.

properties.NAME: St. Lawrence Centre for the Arts
properties.DESCRIPTION: Home to  two theatres, the Bluma Appel Theatre and the Jane Mallett Theatre, the St. Lawrence Centre for the Arts is the home to various artistic and public events.

properties.NAME: St. Lawrence Market & Market Gallery
properties.DESCRIPTION: Voted best fresh food market in the world by National Georgraphic in 2012, Torontots historic and premier market also includes The Market Gallery, housed within part of Torontols original 19th century City Hall.

properties.NAME: Steam Whistle Brewery
properties.DESCRIPTION: A microbrewery located in downtown Toronto, Steam Whistle  Brewery produces a premium pale lager composed of only four ingredients.

properties.NAME: Sugar Beach Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: Sugar Beach is one of Toronto's urban beach parks. Famous for its pink umbrellas and Muskoka chairs.

properties.NAME: Sunnyside Beach
properties.DESCRIPTION: One of Toronto's designated swimming beaches, Sunnyside Beach provides rowers and paddlers calm waters with an offshore break wall.

properties.NAME: Taras H. Shevchenko Museum
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Taras H. Shevchenko Museum is the home to  exhibitions dedicated to the contribution of Ukrainians in Canada and the life of famed writer Taras Shevchenko.

properties.NAME: Tarragon Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Tarragon Theatre is a performing arts centre  notable for the development of playwrights. Over 170 works have premiered at the theatre.

properties.NAME: Textile Museum of Canada
properties.DESCRIPTION: With more than 13,000 objects from more than 200 countries and regions, the Textile Museum of Canada celebrates cultural diversity through traditional fabrics, garments, carpets and related artifacts such as beadwork and basketry.

properties.NAME: The 48th Highlanders Museum
properties.DESCRIPTION: This museum is dedicated to one of Canada's famous military regiments. The museum holds historical artifacts dating from Victorian Toronto in 1891, when the 48th Highlanders was formed, to the present day.

properties.NAME: Aga Khan Museum
properties.DESCRIPTION: Dedicated to sharing the artistic, intellectual, and scientific contributions that Islamic civilizations and cultures have made to world heritage.

properties.NAME: The Bata Shoe Museum
properties.DESCRIPTION: Home to hundreds of shoes (from a collection numbering over 13,000). The museum celebrates the style and function of footwear in impressive galleries from ancient Egypt to modern fashion.

properties.NAME: The Danforth Music Hall
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Music Hall boasts new theatre seats, state-of-art sound and lighting and a completely renovated backstage area.

properties.NAME: The Distillery Historic District
properties.DESCRIPTION: A pedestrian-only historic area that represents the largest and best preserved collection of Victorian Industrial Architecture in North America. The refurbished warehouses are now home to restaurants, bars, galleries, studios, and a theatre.

properties.NAME: The Power Plant Contemporary Art Gallery
properties.DESCRIPTION: Dedicated to contemporary art, the Power Plant is a free public gallery located at the Harbourfront Centre.

properties.NAME: The Second City
properties.DESCRIPTION: Second City produces premiere comedy performances and operates a training centre.

properties.NAME: The Theatre Centre
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Theatre Centre supports artists who wish to develop works of an experimental or alternative nature.  All their artists embrace the visual arts, music, dance and new media.

properties.NAME: The Village Playhouse
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Village Playhouse a non-profit theatre group that opened its doors in 1974 and has since produced plays such as Cat on a Hot Tin Roof, Amadeus and Dial 'M' For Murder.

properties.NAME: Theatre Passe Muraille
properties.DESCRIPTION: Theatre Passe Muraille was CanadaCs original alternative theatre company.   600 Canadian plays have been produced since the company was founded in 1968.

properties.NAME: Thompson Landry Gallery - Stone Building & Cooperage Space
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Thompson Landry Gallery is spread out over 6,000 square feet and showcases artwork from internationally acclaimed contemporary Quebec artists. The gallery opened in 2009 and  is situated within the Distillery District's Cooperage Building.

properties.NAME: TIFF Bell Lightbox
properties.DESCRIPTION: The TIFF Bell Lightbox is the home of the Toronto International Film Festival and a year-round destination for unique screenings, themed festivals, and exhibitions.  It also houses two restaurants.

properties.NAME: Todmorden Mills Heritage Site
properties.DESCRIPTION: Todmorden Mills Heritage Site is situated within the Don Valley and is located beside a 9.2 hectare wildflower preserve. It features historic buildings such as the Brewery building and the Papermill theatre and gallery.

properties.NAME: Tommy Thompson Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: The park is a perfect place for hiking, jogging, cycling and birdwatching.

properties.NAME: Toronto Botanical Gardens and Edwards Gardens
properties.DESCRIPTION: Located at the stunning Edwards Gardens, Toronto Botanical Garden features award-winning themed gardens and an indoor education/interpretation facility.

properties.NAME: Toronto Centre for the Arts
properties.DESCRIPTION: This venue features three unique stages to house a multitude of concerts, shows and events.

properties.NAME: Toronto City Hall & Nathan Phillips Square
properties.DESCRIPTION: Toronto's City Hall is one of Toronto's best known and visited landmarks. Nathan Phillips Square located directly in front of City Hall, is the site of concerts, farmers' markets, and other iconic events.

properties.NAME: Toronto Coach Terminal
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Toronto Coach Terminal provides travellers with bus service to various cities in North America.

properties.NAME: Toronto Congress Centre
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Toronto Congress Centre opened in 1995 and now features over 1 million square feet of space for galas, meetings, trade shows and conventions,

properties.NAME: Toronto Eaton Centre
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Toronto Eaton Centre is downtown Toronto's only shopping mall.  It features over 200 stores and restaurants as well as the sculpture called Flightstop designed by Michael Snow.

properties.NAME: Toronto Island Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Toronto Island Park is North America's largest car free neighbourhood and is only a short ferry ride away from downtown Toronto. The park is features several attractions, beaches, restaurants, bike and boat rentals and plenty of open green space.

properties.NAME: Toronto Music Garden
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Toronto Music Garden is situated on Toronto's newly revamped waterfront.   The garden was designed by landscape designer Julie Moir Messervy and by the cellist Yo Yo Ma.

properties.NAME: Toronto Pearson International Airport
properties.DESCRIPTION: Canadais busiest airport with flights to over 180 destinations around the globe.

properties.NAME: Toronto Police Museum & Discovery Centre
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Toronto Police Museum & Discovery Centre occupies 3,000 square feet within the Police Headquarters building on College Street.  The museum solely relies on private donations and is a not for profit registered charity.

properties.NAME: Toronto Public Labyrinth at Trinity Square
properties.DESCRIPTION: Trinity Square Park offers a unique age-old experience of meditating and relaxing while walking a labyrinth and focusing on personal self-awareness and spiritual growth.

properties.NAME: Toronto Railway Museum
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Toronto Railway Museum encompasses the Canadian Pacific Railway John Street Roundhouse at Roundhouse Park and features a restored turntable, a number of trains and the 1896 Canadian Pacific Don Station.

properties.NAME: Toronto Reference Library
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Toronto Reference Library is situated in a 5 storey building within the Yorkville neighbourhood.  It is the largest public reference library in Canada.

properties.NAME: Toronto Sculpture Garden
properties.DESCRIPTION: Since 1981 this small urban park has featured contemporary sculpture installations by various artists.

properties.NAME: Toronto Zoo
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Toronto Zoo is one of the largest zoos in the world at 287 hectares (710 acres) and is known for interactive education and conservation activities. It is currently home to 2 giant pandas, and more than 5,000 animals representing over 500 species.

properties.NAME: Toronto's First Post Office
properties.DESCRIPTION: Toronto's First Post Office acts as a museum but also continues to operate as a full service Canada Post office.  Admission to the museum is by donation.

properties.NAME: Travellers' Aid Society of Toronto
properties.DESCRIPTION: Travellers' Aid Society of Toronto operates two desks; one at Pearson International Airport and the other within Union Station's grand hall.  They offer free services to the general travelling public.

properties.NAME: Ukrainian Museum of Canada
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Ukrainian Museum of Canada features over 4,000 artifacts.  These artifacts include prints, coins, maps jewellery, textiles and historic costumes.

properties.NAME: Union Station
properties.DESCRIPTION: Union Station is the busiest transportation hub in all of Canada.  It serves more than 250,000 passengers daily.  Via Rail, the TTC, Go Transit and Amtrak all operate out of the station

properties.NAME: Union Station Tourism Information Centre
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Union Station Tourism Information Centre provides travel advice and information to all its customers.  Services include free Wi-Fi service, brochures and souvenirs.

properties.NAME: University of Toronto Art Centre
properties.DESCRIPTION: Originally opened in 1996 The Arts centre puts a special focus on study collections.

properties.NAME: Village of Yorkville Park
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Village of Yorkville Park was built on the site of a former parking lot, in the heart of the Bloor Yorkville neighbourhood.  The main focal point of the park is the rock which weighs 650 tonnes and is approximately 1 billion years old.

properties.NAME: Ward's Island Beach
properties.DESCRIPTION: Ward's Island beach is located on the most Eastern part of the Toronto Islands.  It features a residential neighbourhood, 2 restaurants, a beach and boardwalk.

properties.NAME: Winchester Street Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Winchester Street Theatre is owned and jointly operated by the Toronto Dance Theatre and the School of Toronto Dance Theatre. The venue features rake seating and a stage that best showcases dance performances.

properties.NAME: Woodbine Beach
properties.DESCRIPTION: Woodbine Beach is one of the city's main beaches.  The park is located over 15.2 hectares.  Features include the Martin Goodman Trail and the Donald D. Summerville Outdoor Olympic Pool.

properties.NAME: Woodbine Shopping Centre and Fantasy Fair
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Woodbine Shopping Centre is located within the city's West end; close to Pearson Airport and Woodbine Racetrack.  Fantasy Fair located within the mall is an indoor amusement park for children.  In 2015 it celebrates 30 years.

properties.NAME: Woodbine Racetrack
properties.DESCRIPTION: Offers both Standardbred and Thoroughbred racing and hosts many prominent events (including the Queens Plate)throughout the year.

properties.NAME: Yonge-Dundas Square
properties.DESCRIPTION: Yonge-Dundas Square is one of the city's largest public squares.  It is located directly across from the Toronto Eaton Centre.  The square is home to free movie screenings, concerts, shows and exhibits.

properties.NAME: York Quay Centre
properties.DESCRIPTION: The York Quay Centre is part of the Harbourfront Centre.

properties.NAME: Yorkdale Mall
properties.DESCRIPTION: An upscale shopping centre in Toronto's North West end.

properties.NAME: Young Centre for the Performing Arts
properties.DESCRIPTION: Opened in 2006 the Young Centre for the Performing Arts has seen more than 250,000 people attend its performances.   The theatre is located within the Distillery Historic District.

properties.NAME: Young People's Theatre
properties.DESCRIPTION: The Young People Theatre is a part of the Soulpepper theatre company located within the Distillery Historic District.

properties.NAME: Yuk Yuk's
properties.DESCRIPTION: Yuk Yuk's was established as a comedy club by Mark Breslin in 1976.  It is located within Toronto's entertainment district and features various comedians doing their stand up routines.

properties.NAME: Mattamy Athletic Centre
properties.DESCRIPTION: Mattamy Athletic Centre is located within Maple Leafs Garden and is home to the Ryerson Ram's basketball, hockey and volleyball teams.
